com.fasterxml.clustermate.service.cfg

Enum KeyRangeAllocationStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<KeyRangeAllocationStrategy>
      • com.fasterxml.clustermate.service.cfg.KeyRangeAllocationStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<KeyRangeAllocationStrategy>

    public enum KeyRangeAllocationStrategy
extends Enum<KeyRangeAllocationStrategy>
    Enumeration used for distinguishing different configurations for cluster information, mainly allocation of ranges of key space for nodes.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DYNAMIC_WITH_APPEND
      Configuration setting in which cluster size can be increased by simply adding new nodes at the end of the node list.
      SIMPLE_LINEAR
      Configuration setting in which keyspace is allocated evenly to each node, starting from beginning, and using overlapping setting depending on desired number of copies to keep.
      STATIC
      Fully static configuration means that all configuration comes from the main configuration file, and includes all cluster nodes along with key range information.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • STATIC

        public static final KeyRangeAllocationStrategy STATIC
        Fully static configuration means that all configuration comes from the main configuration file, and includes all cluster nodes along with key range information. This is useful for testing, and simple deployments where cluster setup is unlikely to change, or can be changed with full (but usually incremental) restart of nodes of the cluster.

        No additional node discovery is made, although additional nodes may join cluster if this is enabled.

      • SIMPLE_LINEAR

        public static final KeyRangeAllocationStrategy SIMPLE_LINEAR
        Configuration setting in which keyspace is allocated evenly to each node, starting from beginning, and using overlapping setting depending on desired number of copies to keep.

        When adding nodes in cluster, care must be taken to either add nodes one by one (and waiting until cluster is fully settled), deploying with new configuration between each addition, or doubling up by adding nodes in interleaved fashion. Either way, the goal is to avoid temporary gaps in coverage; typically addition does reduce number of available copies by one for affected regions. If this is not acceptable, other allocation strategies should be used: either STATIC (to manually define ranges with extra redundancy) or DYNAMIC_WITH_APPEND to let system organize intermediate overlaps appropriately.

        No additional node discovery is made, although additional nodes may join cluster if this is enabled.

      • DYNAMIC_WITH_APPEND

        public static final KeyRangeAllocationStrategy DYNAMIC_WITH_APPEND
        Configuration setting in which cluster size can be increased by simply adding new nodes at the end of the node list. Key ranges are dynamically calculated (initially) as well as adjusted when cluster grows.

        When adding nodes, append must be done at the end, and one at a time. New nodes should only be appended once new node has "caught up" with the node it took part of key range from.

        No additional node discovery is made, although additional nodes may join cluster if this is enabled.
